definition: to explore/to search out/to scout/to visit/to stretch forward

sentences.english: The detectives said they'd handle it.
sentences.chinese: 警探們說，他們會處理這事的。

sentences.english: It was not immediately clear whether the attacker knew Stevenson was a police detective.
sentences.chinese: 目前尚不清楚是否攻擊者知道史蒂文森是一名警探。

sentences.english: He directed the detective to unscrew the oven door.
sentences.chinese: 他指揮警探拆烤箱門的鏍絲。

sentences.english: I'm Detective Thomas Moore. This is Detective Rizzoli.
sentences.chinese: 我是莫拓森警探，這位是芮黎真警探。

sentences.english: The rest of the detective's night passed uneventfully.
sentences.chinese: 這位警探的後半夜倒是平安無事。

sentences.english: This is Detective Lin from the Criminal Investigation Divison.
Detectives were set at all the exits.
sentences.chinese: 這些出口都佈署了警探。

definition: abbr. for 刑事警察[xing2 shi4 jing3 cha2]/criminal police
master sleuth/lit. miraculous detective/cf Sherlock Holmes 福爾摩斯|福尔摩斯[Fu2 er3 mo2 si1] or Di Renjie 狄仁傑|狄仁杰[Di2 Ren2 jie2]
secret service/special service/secret service agent/special agent
police department/police station/abbr. of 警察局
Sherlock Holmes, 歇洛克·福爾摩斯|歇洛克·福尔摩斯[Xie1 luo4 ke4 · Fu2 er3 mo2 si1]
police station (abbr. for 警察署[jing3 cha2 shu3])
